generif.text: TREX1, encoding the major mammalian 3' --> 5' DNA exonuclease, is the AGS1 gene, and AGS-causing mutations result in abrogation of TREX1 enzyme activity.
Heterozygous mutations in TREX1 cause familial chilblain lupus and dominant Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome.

identification of a heterozygous missense mutation (D18N) in TREX1 in affected individuals of the family with chilblain lupus; lymphoblastoid cells with the D18N mutation are less sensitive to granzyme A-mediated cell death
Findings implicate TREX1 in the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus.
Truncated proteins retain exonuclease activity but lose normal perinuclear localization.

Trex1 acts on a single-stranded DNA polynucleotide species generated from processing of aberrant replication intermediates to attenuate DNA damage checkpoint signaling and prevent pathological immune activation.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

The objective of this study was to confirm whether polymorphisms of TREX1 and TREX2 are associated with genetic susceptibility to systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), and examine associations with autoantibodies (auto-Abs) in SLE.

A review of the putative functions of TREX1 in relationship to the clinical, genetic and functional characteristics of several diseases caused by mutations in TREX1.

dysfunctional dsDNA degradation activities of these disease-related TREX1 mutants could account for persistent dsDNA from dying cells leading to an aberrant immune response in these clinically related disorders
genetic deficiency causes the spontaneous inflammatory myocarditis
gene mutations cause Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome and chilblain lupus, autoimmune diseases known to involve elevated type I IFN production

TREX1 may act in degrading DNA in all cell types undergoing a dying process before phagocytosis occurs.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
TREX1 mutations do not play a role in the pathogenesis of Sporadic inclusion body myositis.

A single case of a heterozygous TREX1 mutation has been associated with Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome, an encephalopathy often resembling congenital infection.

failure to degrade genomic dsDNA is a principal pathway of immune activation in TREX1-mediated autoimmune disease.

Here we briefly describe the human diseases so-far associated with mutations in TREX1, which include Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome, familial chilblain lupus, systemic lupus erythematosus and retinal vasculopathy with cerebral leukodystrophy
Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome 1 is caused by mutations in the three prime repair exonuclease 1 gene (TREX1, MIM 606609).

Once at the viral genome, CDK11 phosphorylated serines at position 2 in the CTD of RNAPII, which increased levels of cleavage and polyadenylation factors at the HIV 3' end. In its absence, cleavage of viral transcripts was greatly attenuated.

IRF3-mediated induction of type I IFN

summary: This gene encodes a nuclear protein with 3' exonuclease activity. The encoded protein may play a role in DNA repair and serve as a proofreading function for DNA polymerase. Mutations in this gene result in Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome, chilblain lupus, Cree encephalitis, and other diseases of the immune system. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Sep 2012].
